cards.front: Differentiate between Real DOM and Virtual DOM.
cards.back: Virtual DOM updates are faster but do not directly update the HTML

cards.front: How do you modify the state of a different React component?
cards.back: Not at all! State is visible to the component only.

What path will match the follow Route?
<Route>
  <NotFound />
</Route>
cards.back: All paths. A route with no path matches all URL's

dfsgs
card front
Where was the Will Smith’s character “born and raised” in The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air?
What was the name of the pet monkey that Ross had during the early part of the Friends series?
What was the name of the main female lead in the TV show, Boy Meets World?
What was the catch phrase of Michelle Tanner in Full House?
What was the name of the Jack Russell Terrier that was featured on Frasier?
What was the candy that Kramer dropped over the side while watching a medical procedure in Seinfeld?
What was the name of the school principle from Saved by the Bell?
What is the catchphrase from the original TV series, The X-Files?
What was the name of Tim “The Toolman” Taylor’s handyman show from Home Improvement?
What was the name of the restaurant that featured loose meat in the ‘90s sitcom, Roseanne?
What was the name of Eric’s mother in the hit sitcom, That ‘70s Show?
What was the catchphrase of the baby in the television series, Dinosaurs?
What was the job that Dick Soloman worked while on Earth in Third Rock From the Sun?
What was the name of the clown character from the series, In Living Color?
What was the name of the alter ego character for Steve Urkel from Family Matters?
Whose car was the Seinfeld gang looking for in the infamous parking garage episode?
What was the name of the song that was associated with the Carlton dance on The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air?
8A

cards.back: Indicates an informational response; it is unlikely that you will need to return a response in this range.

cards.front: Range: Indicates an informational response; it is unlikely that you will need to return a response in this range.

cards.back: Indicates success; the request was received, understood, and successfully processed.

cards.front: Range: Indicates success; the request was received, understood, and successfully processed.

cards.back: Indicates redirection; a resource at a different URL has been substituted for the requested resource.

cards.front: Range: Indicates redirection; a resource at a different URL has been substituted for the requested resource.

cards.back: Indicates a client error; there is a problem with the way that the client submitted the request.

cards.front: Range: Indicates a client error; there is a problem with the way that the client submitted the request.

cards.back: Indicates a server error; the request was accepted, but an error on the server prevented the request's fulfillment.

cards.front: Range: Indicates a server error; the request was accepted, but an error on the server prevented the request's fulfillment.
OK	The request is successful.

cards.back: CREATED	The request resulted in a resource being successfully created.

cards.front: CREATED	The request resulted in a resource being successfully created.

cards.back: NO CONTENT	The request is successful, and nothing is being returned in the response body. DELETE operations often return this.

cards.front: NO CONTENT	The request is successful, and nothing is being returned in the response body. DELETE operations often return this.

cards.back: BAD REQUEST	The server cannot process the request because of bad syntax, invalid data, excessive size, or another client error.

cards.front: BAD REQUEST	The server cannot process the request because of bad syntax, invalid data, excessive size, or another client error.

cards.back: FORBIDDEN	The client does not have permission to access this resource.

cards.front: FORBIDDEN	The client does not have permission to access this resource.

cards.back: NOT FOUND	The resource could not be found at this time. It may have been deleted or does not exist yet.

cards.front: NOT FOUND	The resource could not be found at this time. It may have been deleted or does not exist yet.

cards.back: METHOD NOT ALLOWED	The HTTP method is not supported by the target resource.

cards.front: METHOD NOT ALLOWED	The HTTP method is not supported by the target resource.

cards.back: INTERNAL SERVER ERROR	The generic answer for an unexpected failure if there is no more specific information available.

cards.front: INTERNAL SERVER ERROR	The generic answer for an unexpected failure if there is no more specific information available.
